verse.roman:
kaccin no bāndhavā rāma
sarve kuśalam āsate
kaccit smaratha no rāma
yūyaṁ dāra-sutānvitāḥ

synonyms: kaccit—whether; naḥ—our; bāndhavāḥ—relatives; rāma—O Balarāma; sarve—all; kuśalam—well; āsate—are; smaratha—remember; naḥ—us; rāma—O Rāma; yūyam—all of you; dāra—with wives; suta—and children; anvitāḥ—together.
translation: [The cowherds said:] O Rāma, are all our relatives doing well? And Rāma, do all of you, with your wives and children, still remember us?
